Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnD6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a fantastic location - very easy to get to all the major attractions. Nice atmosphere and nice, helpful staff. Our room was spacious and nicely designed. One suggestion for travelers who like to sleep in...request a room on the opposite side from the elementary school next door. Although the windows do a good job of keeping the playground noise out, if you have the window open you will hear the kids playing outside.

Reviews.Title: “5* Location”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: First-rate location, a 5-minute walk from St. Mark's square and close to lovely restaurants. We stayed in a standard double, which was modern, stylish and cosy. The breakfast was typical continental, but very good. The vaparetto and airport ferry stops were a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Overall our stay was brilliant, the only negative comment I do have is the air con was not turned on during our stay (even though it was included in the price). When we reported this we were told they get charged extra tax this time of year to have the air con on. Not a major issue as it was not too hot during our stay at the end of March. I would recommend this hotel for the location and modern take on Venetian decor.

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel, 3* service”
Reviews.Author: kevinfitton
Reviews.Content: Great location in central Venice, well-appointed hotel with lovely design and luxury rooms. Breakfast OK but a bit repetitive. Stayed during the Easter hols weekend, so was paying $500 per night, a lot of money, so....... Disappointed with the poor attention to detail and service. The staff were surly and unhelpful; they seemed unaware of my daughter's dietary needs, despite informing them several times. They then made little effort to help us address them. There were some other niggles - the wi-fi wasn't free, the door entry system was rubbish ( only one key, so once someone was in the room, anyone else had to knock to get in - a problem late at night ) the TV didn't work properly, there was no facility to pay the bill by debit card ( bancomat ) All in all, when paying so much for a room, these niggles spoilt an otherwise great stay. I have been told that the Venetians are generally complacent and unfriendly ( they don't have to try too hard, as they believe that the city sells itself ) but again, this is no excuse for shabby customer service.

Reviews.Title: “optimal tradeoff”
Reviews.Author: dartes
Reviews.Content: Very close to San Marco square and cathedral (approx. 200m.), this hotel shows acceptable prices and absolutely clean and confortable rooms. Main Venice sites are at walking distance and any other can be reached by public transportations. No internal restaurant but a lot of choices in two hundred meter radius.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lew
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect (except the rain head shower made the bathroom floor wet) The room was large, the beds comfortable, the bathroom fabulously done. It was exquisitely clean and the staff was always helpful and friendly. It is close to St Marks square and certainly in the upscale section of Venice. The charge for the wi-fi was surprising but fair (high bandwidth connection). The directions to the hotel seem odd but fit exactly and it is perhaps a 3 minute walk from the San Marcos-San Zaccaria stop on the 1 or 2 vaporeto stop with no bridges to climb over with your luggage. I think that the two negative reviews on this hotel may be in error- there are at least one other hotel in Venice with Principi as part of the name and the details cited don't match with this hotel.(no bathtubs and no adjoining apartments) I would certainly return to this hotel on any trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hit”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: Room apparently had water damage, so arrived early evening to no room (it happens I guess). They offered to put us up in their recently renovated apartment, but when the bell man walked me over to the empty buildings, the hallway was filled with construction (tubs, and other stuff) materials. There was no services including no WiFi, the guy actually thought it was a plus that a kitchen was included. We were supposed to walk over to the hotel for the breakfast. I'm in Venice for 2 nights and paying nearly $400/night, you think I'm going to find a grocery?? A second offer was made for the hotel next door, and they would move us the second night. I called Expedia and they moved us within the hour.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Ehsan A
Reviews.Content: super nice hotel, great location, 5 minute walk to St. Marks Square and Water taxi stop to airport. Beautiful interior, decor and design. Delicious breakfast in the morning!!! Definately recommend, 4 star hotel, but rate it 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place,horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: John19661966
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in family suite. Nice,clean,large room facing the gondola riddled canals-beautiful. Only complaints are- 1.The cheap and nasty breakfast not befitting of a hotel of this standard-"juice" which has 0%fruit,old industrial bread etc 2.Having to pay for wifi. This hotel was 3 times more expensive than anywhere else we stayed in Italy yet remained the only place which demanded a fee for wifi

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel-small rooms”
Reviews.Author: MariaNicole84
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here during our honeymoon for 2 nights.The room was MUCH smaller than in all the photos online. We could barely walk around in the room it was so tiny! So this was a bit dissapointing. The room itself is modern and clean and the bathroom is very nice and large considering the size of the room. My only other complaint is they give you VERY thin sheets on the bed and we asked for another blanket but they did not have any. Other than that the hotel is nice and clean and they include a continental breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for female solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Mighteenomad
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveler, I was very happy with the location and felt safe in the neighborhood. The hotel is close to a water stop, to Piazza San Marco, to the Arsenale and Giardini, and to a few restaurants and bars. If you follow the hotelâ€™s directions (on their website) from the San Zaccaria water stop then itâ€™s very easy to get to the hotel. Considering that I arrived during the Biennale and towards the end of the Film Festival, I wasnâ€™t surprised by the high rates. Yes, it is a bit expensive, but overall I was very happy with the hotel. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. They were willing to make reservations for me and printed out train schedules. The dÃ©cor of my room was modern and tastefully decorated. I also enjoyed the shower and the body jets. The air conditioning sometimes worked TOO well where I was cold and had to turn it off. Breakfast was average. The only disappointing thing was that you had to pay for Wi-Fi (8 euro for 12 hours). If you buy Wi-Fi, they give you a pass for logging on and off. Donâ€™t forget to log-out or you lose that time. I often used the cafÃ© on the corner of San Zaccaria and San Provolo for free Wi-Fi and a snack.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive, but welcome in Venise !”
Reviews.Author: nc_cafeine
Reviews.Content: Breakfast are excellent. The bathroom was great with all this brillant ceramics. We had a nice room with a special ceiling fresco. We thougt we had a free visit to Murano but it was only a free ticket to go (not to come back...). Even if the hotel was great, we found Venise very very expensive after visiting Florence, Cinque Terre, Toscana (Chianti) and Verona.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE!!! JUST PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: dcallipari
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Hotel Ai Due Principi at the end of a 2 week trip to Italy. This hotel surpassed all of my expectations! We booked The Junior Suite so that our whole family could be together. When we entered the room, I just about cried - it was SO beautiful, from the floor & ceiling to the magnificent bathroom! The photos on their website are very accurate! Everything about this hotel was wonderful! It was clean, authentic, and the location was excellent - close enough to everything that short walks in every direction brought you to a new experience. Rifath & Cristina, who both work at the front desk, were so absolutely wonderful and helpful and full of information. We took a private water taxi from the airport and you get dropped off just around the corner from the hotel; you only have to walk over one small bridge (maybe 6 steps up and 6 down), so be aware of this if you are carrying a lot of luggage; though it is not a big deal. The front of the hotel looks out to a smaller canal where gondolas float by regularly! Our room had a spectacular view of another smaller canal. If/when I get back to Venice, I will DEFINITELY stay here again! Do NOT hesitate staying at this fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: GlynRB
Reviews.Content: Room excellent, bed excellent. Staff friendly and helpful. Difficult to find. Take the Water Bus to San Zaccaria. It's the fastest way to get there from the airport. You will need help to find the hotel the first time. Call and ask for directions. They will send someone. It's not very impressive at first sight, but the rooms are beautifully presented in a modern style that shows some of the best of Italian design. There is a charge for internet access, but it is 10Mbps and the charge is per minute actually used. So as long as you remember to log out, its very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: theskin
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk to waterbus (which connects you to the airport) and St Marks, very central location on a canal. Good size room, helpful staff and the continental breakfasts were great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Modern Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mmsakis
Reviews.Content: We spent the first four night of our honeymoon at Hotel Ai Due Principi and we had a wonderful experience. The rooms are very a good size, modern and clean (the only complaint I have is the yucky shower curtain - it was time to change it). The breakfast was also very good and the location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jules693
Reviews.Content: Rather unusually this hotel looks exactly as it looks on its website. We had room 201, with twin beds. It was just beautiful and the huge bathroom was stunning. Whirlpool bath with shower and separate huge shower stall with wall jets,fixed shower head and removable shower head. Excellent maid service every day. Beds turned down each night with chocolate left. Breakfast was continental with so much choice: rolls, filled croissants, yoghurts, cereal, cheese, cold cuts, pancakes, boiled eggs, juices, tea, coffee, cappuccino. Concierge very helpful. Easy easy access from the San Zaccaria quay -no bridges to cross with your luggage. We splurged on a water taxi from the airport with another couple - â‚¬50 each couple - but it was an exhilarating ride in a beautiful wooden speedboat. We returned via the municipal ferry - â‚¬13 each and that was fine (Alilaguna blue line from San Zaccaria). The hotel is less than 5 minute's walk from Campo San Marco but is in a very quiet neighbourhood. The front rooms overlook a canal, we overlooked a courtyard at the back. One word of warning- we were there first week of October and it was very warm. The porter closed our windows and put the a/c on but we turned it off and threw open the windows to enjoy the fresh air. At 1.30am I was awakened by a buzzing in my ear - and was covered in mosquito bites. So we kept the windows shut and a/c on for the rest of our stay. Overall we were thrilled with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Excellent location for exploring Venice. We walked all over and only used the vaporetto once to go the length of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: veneziaamore
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel in located in the Castello district of Venice very close to St. Mark's Square. One of the nicest hotels around with elevator and recently remodeled. The room was quiet, and very comfortable. It also included a nice breakfast selection and wi fi internet connection. I received much personalized attention from the owner and her staff. I would highly recommend staying here if you are in Venice and I plan on returning here on my next trip to Venice next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully modern hotel in the heart of an ancient city”
Reviews.Author: skoch1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It is tucked away on a small canal, but only 2-3 walking minutes away from the San Zaccharia water bus stop. It is very important to note that there are no stairs or bridges that need to climbed when walking from the water bus. We witnessed many tourists lugging their suitcases up the bridges on the way to their hotel and felt very fortunate / smart for not having that experience. The hotel's lobby is very stylish and modern. We were greeted by an english speaking staff member who checked us in and gave us some general tips about Venice. He continued to be helpful throughout our stay and even went out of his way to help us charge our iPod when we realized we forgot the charger. Our Superior room was large by any standard, North American or otherwise. It was decorated in a modern, but comfortable style. Our bathroom was just insane. The pictures we saw on TA were the reason we stayed here, and why you should too. A few notes: - People that complain about the noise are crazy. We did notice that you can faintly hear some music in the room during the day, but it seemed to be coming from a bar that closed around 9pm. - The shower in our bathroom had no edges to it, so the entire bathroom basically flooded every time we showered. Not that big a deal since they provided us with slippers, but still a bit annoying. Maybe it's done that way to make it wheelchair friendly? - They charge a reasonable fee for wireless internet access in the room. It worked fine, but at the rate we paid the internet should be free. - If you stay here, you must have a spritz in the courtyard. We could have spent the rest of our lives relaxing out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and attention”
Reviews.Author: walnutlobe
Reviews.Content: Niice, clean and great location. Breakfast is great a little bit of everything. Cristina very attentive in pleasing and making your stay perfect. Will go back and completely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: Iras
Reviews.Content: This is a small 4*star hotel, near S Marcus square, rooms are spacious, clean and stylish!We booked trough their website the "roullette" and despite getting the standard room the price was still very good concerning the prices we have seen in other hotels in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the plus points stop there”
Reviews.Author: BearAlarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for part of our minimoon. Firstly the positives - the location was excellent, tucked down a side street overlooking a quaint canal and only 4 minutes from St Marco's square. Now for the negatives: Obviously, if you have been to Venice before you will know that it is an expensive city so one cannot quibble on price as their rates are pretty par for the course. HOWEVER, as for the rooms, the suite and upgraded room we stayed in on our last night were quite small even by Venice standards and not exactly well designed either. The boring and lackluster decoration aside, there was no air con in either of our rooms and only a heating system. This meant that we baked and woke up each morning with headaches. Please bear in mind that this was only April so heaven knows how this will be in the summer!! The one night we decided to cool the room down by opening the windows, was the same night we were attacked by three mosquitoes and bitten from head to toe. My second fault is with the breakfast. If you go expecting a gourmet feast befitting of a 4 star hotel, you will be very disappointed. Every effort was made to make the breakfast as cheap as possible - day old bread rolls, sweaty cheese in small plastic wrappers, orange juice made from concentrate and horribly cheap jams. Fine for a 2 star hotel but not a 4 star one. My final complaint is with the staff - we found them to be aloof at times, bordering on the arrogant and not very helpful at all. On are final day we asked one of the guys to tell us where we could catch a water bus to the airport from - a common request you might think but he told us the wrong bus stop and we almost missed our plane! Overall, we had hoped for something more special for this part of our minimoon, but the hotel itself is very forgettable and indeed, considering the nights' sleep we had and the service we got, this is probably no bad thing. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Shady management”
Reviews.Author: IowaCityTraveller007
Reviews.Content: Beware of Room 007 ~ they make it sound special ~ but it really is a glorified "Closet" right outside the lower level entrance to the elevator ( i mean- right on the otherside of our door) the was no privacy , the bed was a foam futon - barley big enough for one person to sleep in let alone two. Right upon check-in I asked for another room & that request was swiftly denied ( they said the hotel was full- but there were people checking out) The bathroom was cut -up into funny angles (as part of the closet behind the receptionists desk) the following morning (after getting a terrible nights sleep) i asked for a different room & was denied any type of new accommodation. I informed the desk I was checking out. Then they offered a new room- after we wait 1 more night- I refused ; & they then waived our wifi-minibar fees & gave us no receipt for check out. we called expedia immeadiately - we could not get through to the manager- they would not answer the call from the states, after 10 days, i got through finaly, expedia told us the manager was unwilling to waive the hotel charges for the two days we did not stay there!! we got burned for $450.00 I may not use expedia again ~ and I recommend no one trust the hotel ai du principi hotel in venice, it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - in fact very good!”
Reviews.Author: max29
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Venice for 6 nights - it was my first trip. First of all the city - incredible never saw anything like it before - couple of very quick points - bring a map with you everywhere! I would say summer is horrific, crowds, smells, heat. We went in Oct and it was still very warm but pleasant maybe low 20's the crowds had gone but still very busy so if going i would say up to March/April or after September because during high season i would imagine its not pleasant. The hotel - excellent location 5 minutes form marks square, the mgt structure seems a bit odd but i think its family run - we had no major problems the day time manager was courteous wouldn't exactly bowl you over with friendliness but he was ok. The owners were a lot more chatty etc. The room was lovely very big and spacious and had a small view over the canal. Top of the range everything in the rooms and bathrooms - it was an exclusive canal room we had and really top range everything. One minor gripe if you're alight sleeper like me bring ear plugs as the windows are old listed type and wouldn't be great for keeping noise out. I had my ear plugs and slept like a lamb - v comfy beds The hotel is only about 2 years old i think.If you're going off season try mailing the hotel as i did and got a 10-15% discount over the website price. Breakfast is fine teas, coffees, ham eggs etc its pretty nice. They have an internet station you pay for use but it is really cheap. The cost was 1500 euro for 6 nights with a small canal view in October - expensive but venice is very expensive accommodation wise. I think i would stay here again the location and everything was great. Buy a guide book before you go the top 10 is pretty good, get a map as well! Treviso is a bit of a joke of an airport long queues etc and the ryanair shuttle bus is also poor enough. Brilliant brilliant city definitely will go back

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment! Shameful customer service.”
Reviews.Author: elise0360
Reviews.Content: Venice is beautiful and my fiance and I were there celebrating our 1 year engagement and our Birthdays, so it was to be a special trip. I had searched the internet for a nice hotel where we wouldn't get ripped off as Venice is quite expensive. I was happy to find the 'Run of the House' rate at the Hotel ai due Principi, I had seen the hotel and was impressed by the reviews. It only worked out about Â£20 cheaper but it and I quote 'Guaranteed you the best room available'. Little did we know, we got there early and our room wasn't ready, which was were fine, as it was midday, the reception staff took our bags and we went and got lost, perfect. We returned to the hotel and the receptionist was unsure of where our room was, he then realised and said "oh you room is next door" we went to the the hotel next door which looks okay on the outside. We went into the room, which I remembered seeing online and didn't even consider it to be one of our choices to stay its also lower starred hotel. The room was vile to say the least and had no view what so ever. You would think that if you had to put customers in another hotel you would at least give them a nice room. We were not happy and went back next door and told the receptionist and he said there are no rooms tonight, but tomorrow you can have a complimentary upgrade to an executive room over looking the canal. Still quite annoyed that we were not staying in the hotel we booked and paid for we thought fine we will have a nice room tomorrow. Come the next day we went to the reception and was told to wait for the director as he want to speak to us. There was me thinking he was going to apologise, but much to my disbelief he turned around and said "there were no rooms in this hotel, next door is our sister hotel you have to stay there!" Dumbfounded I asked him to explain why and he wouldn't so I asked for a refund for both nights as I wasn't getting what I had paid for. He had a little chat with the receptionist and suddenly there was a room available! We took the room thinking it would be the so called upgrade we were offered the day before. It wasn't, it was the standard room, which was ok, as it was the room we had booked. They hotel manager has no idea how to talk/treat his PAYING customers, we found him extremely rude and arrogant. The other staff were nice enough but under him they are granted useless, which is a shame. The customer service at the hotel was disgraceful, it ruined our trip. I would never stay at this hotel again even if I was paid too. I would definitely recommend staying at a more reputable hotel as there are so many other. I just wish this hotel had lived up to its reviews. If your are thinking of staying here I would take the 5 star reviews with a pinch of salt!

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Giofak-Lugano
Reviews.Content: I generally have VERY low expectations of hotels in Italy, especially in touristic centers, but this Hotel was a fantastic surprise: new and modern, centrally located, sparkling clear and friendly staff, all for an excellent price. Can only recommend it to everybody who wants peace, kind staff, clean rooms and large, modern bathrooms smack in the middle of Venice, 5 min walking from Piazza San Marco and with cozy restaurants in the surroundings. Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we ever had in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: jagiandi
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this fantastic hotel and the best short holiday we ever had in Italy. The occasion was the birthday of my husband and our wedding anniversary. We were not sure to go to Venice in August but finally it was a very good timing. It was not too crowded and the perfect location of the hotel allowed us to wake up early and few minutes later being on San Marco before the daily tourists arrived. The street of the hotel is calm and lovely with its canal in the middle of the old city and out of the mass at the same time. Cristina and Alberto made our stay perfect with their suggestion for restaurants and a little explanation of Venetians life. Our room was decorated with last design furniture and the bathroom has beautiful glass mosaics. Jacuzzi in our bathroom was a top on the comfort. Delicious Italian breakfast, original ceiling frescos and real mosaic floors all are there. I told already to all my friends and colleagues to reserve this hotel whenever they go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - our favorite hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Jennall
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on all of our hotels and were very pleasantly surprised with the Ai Due Principi. We were only in Venice for two nights but this was by far our favorite hotel in Italy. The hotel is only 6 months old, our room was brand new - the bathroom was very large, great shower (we were randomly given the handicap room on the first floor) and the staff were very helpful and nice with recommendations. Breakfast was included which was ok; we aren't breakfast eaters so coffee and some toast worked for us. The location is right by St. Mark's Square which is great and convenient for everything. Beautiful city. Will definitely recommend to all our friends and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lovec33
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly & helpfull. We stayed in a superior double roo. The room was very big with very nice & stylish furniture. We had a huge double bed. The location was perfect. A very nice & quiet area close to everything. Five minuetes from San Marco square. I loved the gondolas passing by when open the window and the gondilieries singing. It was great!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel ai due Principi
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 4971 | Fondamenta dell'Osmarin, 30122 Venice, Italy
